ossj.qos.fmri
Interface EnvironmentConstants

All Known Implementing Classes:
AlarmMonitorSessionBean, BackEndAlarmMessageBean
public interface EnvironmentConstants

EnvironmentConstants Environment constants used for the threshold monitor EJBs. Note that all EJB references or environment might not be defined for all EJBs, that is the specified constant might be present in the ejb-jar.xml file for some EJBs but not all.

To not cause any missunderstandings. The constants defined here are not the actual values for the constants. Instead they refer to the java:comp/env namespace environment property names defined in the deployment descriptor file ejb-jar.xml. In the deployment descriptor these property names have the actual value assigned to them. That means that a constant here should not be changed unless the property name has been changed in the deployment descriptor!

The property values are retrieved from the EJB (application server) using JNDI.

The constants APPLICATION_CONTEXT_PROPERTY_PROVIDER_URL and APPLICATION_CONTEXT_PROPERTY_INITIAL_CONTEXT_FACTORY are the only exception. They do not refer to a "java:comp/env" property directly, but relatively beneath the APPLICATION_CONTEXT_JNDI namespace.

Author:
Henrik Lindstrom Adapted for the FMRI Not all environment constants used in the current implementation

INCLUDE_APPLICATION_INFO_PROPERTY_NAME

public static final java.lang.String INCLUDE_APPLICATION_INFO_PROPERTY_NAME
The property includeApplicationInfo is used as a flag to determine if the application distinguished name shall be included in the generated events and if the alarm key application context should be populated.
